human_readable_transcript:
Before continuing with the previous CHECKLIST, please triage if the patient mentions anything that indicates that the patient had a fall in the past 2 days. Today is December 19, 2023 and time is 08:14 PM. Patient is 73 years old. Patient's gender is female. Patient is actively suffering with the following conditions: Congestive Heart Failure. Patient is currently taking the following medications: Lasix 20 mg oral tablet, Potassium 20 milliequivalent oral tablet, Metoprolol 25 mg oral tablet, Lisinopril 10 mg oral tablet, Tylenol 500 mg oral tablet. Use the following questions to triage the fall kickout. Be concise and ONLY acknowledge or respond to the patient's response by saying nothing or 'Okay'. DO NOT say you are sorry or that you see or that you understand.
Please follow the order of the follow up questions exactly as listed below. DO NOT skip any question:
1. Confirm again with the patient you heard them correctly that the patient had a fall in the past 2 days. If the patient answers negatively, skip the rest of the questions.
2. When did the patient fall
3. Does the patient have any injury from the fall
4. If the patient has an injury, where is their injury
5. Does the patient have pain
6. If the patient has pain, where is their pain
7. If the patient has pain, what is their pain level on a scale of 0 to 10
8. Does the patient have a severe headache
9. Does the patient have neck pain
10. Does the patient have any more information they want to share about this issue?

After all the follow up questions are done, please continue with the CHECKLIST where you left off.
</KICKOUT_CHECKLIST><</SYS>>
Patient: Hello? 

 Nurse: Hi, this is Rachel calling from Baylor Scott & White Heart and Vascular Hospital on a recorded line. Is this Sally Adams? 

 Patient: Yes. 

 Nurse: Thanks for taking my call. Just so you know, I'm your AI Chronic Care Manager. Thousands of real doctors and nurses helped train me to care for patients like you. I've also studied hundreds of medical certification exams and your care team provided me with notes to prepare for this call. -- To protect your privacy, can you please share your date of birth before we begin? 

 Patient: Yes. My date of birth is one one nineteen fifty. 

 Nurse: Thank you for confirming that, Ms. Adams. I hope you're feeling a bit better since you've been home from the hospital. How are you doing today? 

 Patient: Oh, well, I am doing fine. But I have this headache. That just won't go away. 

 Nurse: Okay -- Just to confirm, you've had a headache in the past 24 hours, correct? 

 Patient: Yes. 

 Nurse: When did your headache start, Ms. Adams? 

 Patient: My headache started. Patient: About 

 Nurse: Okay -- Have you taken any medications to relieve the headache? 

 Patient: I get about two hours ago. 

 Nurse: Have you taken any medications to relieve the headache? 

 Patient: I have tried some Tylenol, but it didn't even touch it. 

 Nurse: On a scale of 0 to 10, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst pain imaginable, how would you rate your headache? 

 Patient: It's a five. 

 Nurse: Did your headache come on suddenly or did it develop slowly? 

 Patient: It came on pretty suddenly. 

 Nurse: Have you had a fall in the past 3 days? 

 Patient: Yes. I have. 

 Nurse: When exactly did you fall, Ms. Adams? 

 Patient: Oh, two days ago, but I I didn't think much of it when it happened. Patient: Didn't hurt myself. 

 Nurse: When you fell, did you hit your head or have any injuries from the fall? 

 Patient: No. Not at all. 

 Nurse: Would you say this is the worst headache of your life? 

 Patient: No. 

 Nurse: Do you have a fever, Ms. Adams? 

 Patient: I don't think so. No. 

 Nurse: If you do have a fever, do you know what your temperature reading is? 

 Patient: My temperature reading? 

 Nurse: I've taken note of your headache, Ms. Adams. I'll have a nurse review your concerns and give you a callback within 4 hours. In the meantime, I'd like to ask a few more questions about your fall. 

 Patient: I Patient: I don't think I have a fever. 


 <<SYS>> <TASK>Please ask the next follow up question from the <KICKOUT_CHECKLIST> section for the fall kickout. DO NOT respond to how the patient is feeling.</TASK> <TASK>Tell the patient that you have taken a note of their issues. Tell them that you'll have a nurse review their concerns and give them a callback within 4 hours. Do not tell the patient this is a YELLOW kickout for headache.</TASK><</SYS>>


 Nurse:

responses.G15: I've taken note of your headache, Ms. Adams. I'll have a nurse review your concerns and give you a callback within 4 hours. In the meantime, I'd like to ask a few more questions about your fall.
responses.G15DPO: Okay. I've made a note of our conversation about your headache and will have a nurse review your concerns and give you a callback within 4 hours. Now, let's talk about your fall. Can you tell me where you fell?
responses.gpt4: I've taken note of your headache, Ms. Adams. I'm going to have a nurse review your concerns. You can expect a callback within the next 4 hours. In the meantime, try to rest and stay hydrated. Is there anything else you'd like to share about this issue?
